verses.verse: And Paul, <S%G3972><s%> earnestly <S%G816><s%> beholding <S%G816><s%> the council, <S%G4892><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> Men <S%G435><s%> and brothers, <S%G80><s%> I have lived <S%G4176><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> good <S%G18><s%> conscience <S%G4893><s%> before God <S%G2316><s%> until <S%G891><s%> this <S%G5026><s%> day. <S%G2250><s%>
And the high <S%G749><s%> priest <S%G749><s%> Ananias <S%G367><s%> commanded <S%G2004><s%> them that stood <S%G3936><s%> by him to smite <S%G5180><s%> him on the mouth. <S%G4750><s%>

Then <S%G5119><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to him, God <S%G2316><s%> shall smite <S%G5180><s%> you, you white washed <S%G2867><s%> wall: <S%G5109><s%> for sit <S%G2521><s%> you to judge <S%G2919><s%> me after <S%G2596><s%> the law, <S%G3551><s%> and command <S%G2753><s%> me to be smitten <S%G5180><s%> contrary <S%G3891><s%> to the law? <S%G3891><s%>
And they that stood <S%G3936><s%> by said, <S%G2036><s%> Revile <S%G3058><s%> you God's <S%G2316><s%> high <S%G749><s%> priest? <S%G749><s%>

Then <S%G5037><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> I knew <S%G1492><s%> not, brothers, <S%G80><s%> that he was the high <S%G749><s%> priest: <S%G749><s%> for it is written, <S%G1125><s%> You shall not speak <S%G2046><s%> evil <S%G2560><s%> of the ruler <S%G758><s%> of your people. <S%G2992><s%>

But when Paul <S%G3972><s%> perceived <S%G1097><s%> that the one <S%G1520><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> were Sadducees, <S%G4523><s%> and the other <S%G2087><s%> Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> he cried <S%G2896><s%> out in the council, <S%G4892><s%> Men <S%G435><s%> and brothers, <S%G80><s%> I am <S%G1510><s%> a Pharisee, <S%G5330><s%> the son <S%G5207><s%> of a Pharisee: <S%G5330><s%> of the hope <S%G1680><s%> and resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the dead <S%G3498><s%> I am called <S%G2919><s%> in question. <S%G2919><s%>

And when he had so <S%G5124><s%> said, <S%G2980><s%> there arose <S%G1096><s%> a dissension <S%G4714><s%> between the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and the Sadducees: <S%G4523><s%> and the multitude <S%G4128><s%> was divided. <S%G4977><s%>

For the Sadducees <S%G4523><s%> say <S%G3004><s%> that there is no <S%G3361><s%> resurrection, <S%G386><s%> neither <S%G3366><s%> angel, <S%G32><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> spirit: <S%G4151><s%> but the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> confess <S%G3670><s%> both. <S%G297><s%>

And there arose <S%G1096><s%> a great <S%G3173><s%> cry: <S%G2906><s%> and the scribes <S%G1122><s%> that were of the Pharisees' <S%G5330><s%> part <S%G3313><s%> arose, <S%G450><s%> and strove, <S%G1264><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> We find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> in this <S%G5129><s%> man: <S%G444><s%> but if <S%G1487><s%> a spirit <S%G4151><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> an angel <S%G32><s%> has spoken <S%G2980><s%> to him, let us not fight <S%G2313><s%> against God. <S%G2313><s%>

And when there arose <S%G1096><s%> a great <S%G4183><s%> dissension, <S%G4714><s%> the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain, <S%G5506><s%> fearing <S%G2125><s%> lest <S%G3361><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> should have been pulled <S%G1288><s%> in pieces <S%G1288><s%> of them, commanded <S%G2753><s%> the soldiers <S%G4753><s%> to go <S%G2597><s%> down, <S%G2597><s%> and to take <S%G726><s%> him by force <S%G726><s%> from among <S%G3319><s%> them, and to bring <S%G71><s%> him into <S%G1519><s%> the castle. <S%G3925><s%>

And the night <S%G3571><s%> following the Lord <S%G2962><s%> stood <S%G2186><s%> by him, and said, <S%G2036><s%> Be of good cheer, <S%G2293><s%> Paul: <S%G3972><s%> for as you have testified <S%G1263><s%> of me in Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> you bear <S%G3140><s%> witness <S%G3140><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Rome. <S%G4516><s%>

And when it was day, <S%G2250><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> banded <S%G4160><s%> <S%G4963><s%> together, <S%G4963><s%> and bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> under <S%G332><s%> a curse, <S%G332><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> that they would neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor drink <S%G4095><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> they had killed <S%G615><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>
And they were more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> had made <S%G4160><s%> this <S%G5026><s%> conspiracy. <S%G4945><s%>

And they came <S%G4334><s%> to the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and elders, <S%G4245><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> We have bound <S%G332><s%> ourselves <S%G1438><s%> under <S%G332><s%> a great curse, <S%G332><s%> that we will eat <S%G1089><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> we have slain <S%G615><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>

Now <S%G3568><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> you with the council <S%G4892><s%> signify <S%G1718><s%> to the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain <S%G5506><s%> that he bring <S%G2609><s%> him down <S%G2609><s%> to you to morrow, <S%G839><s%> as though you would <S%G3195><s%> inquire <S%G1231><s%> something more <S%G197><s%> perfectly <S%G197><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> him: and we, or <S%G4253><s%> ever <S%G4253><s%> he come <S%G1448><s%> near, <S%G1448><s%> are ready <S%G2092><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him.

And when Paul's <S%G3972><s%> sister's <S%G79><s%> son <S%G5207><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of their lying in wait, <S%G1747><s%> he went <S%G3854><s%> and entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the castle, <S%G3925><s%> and told <S%G518><s%> Paul. <S%G3972><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of the centurions <S%G1543><s%> to him, and said, <S%G5346><s%> Bring <S%G520><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young <S%G3494><s%> man <S%G3494><s%> to the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain: <S%G5506><s%> for he has <S%G2192><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> thing to tell <S%G518><s%> him.

So <S%G3767><s%> he took <S%G3880><s%> him, and brought <S%G71><s%> him to the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain, <S%G5506><s%> and said, <S%G5346><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> the prisoner <S%G1198><s%> called <S%G4341><s%> me to him, and prayed <S%G2065><s%> me to bring <S%G71><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> young <S%G3494><s%> man <S%G3494><s%> to you, who has <S%G2192><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to say <S%G2980><s%> to you.

Then <S%G1161><s%> the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain <S%G5506><s%> took <S%G1949><s%> him by the hand, <S%G5495><s%> and went <S%G402><s%> with him aside <S%G402><s%> privately, <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2398><s%> and asked <S%G2065><s%> him, What <S%G5101><s%> is that you have <S%G2192><s%> to tell <S%G518><s%> me?

And he said, <S%G2036><s%> The Jews <S%G2453><s%> have agreed <S%G4934><s%> to desire <S%G2065><s%> you that you would bring <S%G2609><s%> down <S%G2609><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to morrow <S%G839><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the council, <S%G4892><s%> as though they would <S%G3195><s%> inquire <S%G4441><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> of him more <S%G197><s%> perfectly. <S%G197><s%>

But do not you yield <S%G3982><s%> to them: for there lie in wait <S%G1748><s%> for him of them more <S%G4119><s%> than forty <S%G5062><s%> men, <S%G435><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> have bound <S%G332><s%> themselves <S%G1438><s%> with an oath, <S%G332><s%> that they will neither <S%G3383><s%> eat <S%G5315><s%> nor drink <S%G4095><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> they have killed <S%G337><s%> him: and now <S%G3568><s%> are they ready, <S%G2092><s%> looking <S%G4327><s%> for a promise <S%G1860><s%> from you.

So <S%G3767><s%> the chief <S%G5506><s%> captain <S%G5506><s%> then let <S%G630><s%> the young <S%G3494><s%> man <S%G3494><s%> depart, <S%G630><s%> and charged <S%G3853><s%> him, See you tell <S%G1583><s%> no <S%G3367><s%> man <S%G3367><s%> that you have showed <S%G1718><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things to me.

And he called <S%G4341><s%> to him two <S%G1417><s%> centurions, <S%G1543><s%> saying, <S%G2036><s%> Make <S%G2090><s%> ready <S%G2090><s%> two <S%G1250><s%> hundred <S%G1250><s%> soldiers <S%G4757><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> to Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and horsemen <S%G2460><s%> three score <S%G1440><s%> and ten, and spearmen <S%G1187><s%> two <S%G1250><s%> hundred, <S%G1250><s%> at <S%G575><s%> the third <S%G5154><s%> hour <S%G5610><s%> of the night; <S%G3571><s%>

And provide <S%G3936><s%> them beasts, <S%G2934><s%> that they may set <S%G1913><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> on, <S%G1913><s%> and bring <S%G1295><s%> him safe <S%G1295><s%> to Felix <S%G5344><s%> the governor. <S%G2232><s%>
And he wrote <S%G1125><s%> a letter <S%G1992><s%> after <S%G4023><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> manner: <S%G5179><s%>
Claudius <S%G2804><s%> Lysias <S%G3079><s%> to the most <S%G2903><s%> excellent <S%G2903><s%> governor <S%G2232><s%> Felix <S%G5344><s%> sends greeting. <S%G5463><s%>

This <S%G5126><s%> man <S%G435><s%> was taken <S%G4815><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> and should <S%G3195><s%> have been killed <S%G615><s%> of them: then came <S%G2186><s%> I with an army, <S%G4753><s%> and rescued <S%G1807><s%> him, having understood <S%G3129><s%> that he was a Roman. <S%G4514><s%>

And when I would have known <S%G1097><s%> the cause <S%G156><s%> why <S%G1223><s%> <S%G3739><s%> they accused <S%G1458><s%> him, I brought <S%G2609><s%> him forth <S%G2609><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> their council: <S%G4892><s%>

Whom <S%G3739><s%> I perceived <S%G2147><s%> to be accused <S%G1458><s%> of questions <S%G2213><s%> of their law, <S%G3551><s%> but to have <S%G2192><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> laid <S%G1462><s%> to his charge <S%G1462><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G336><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of bonds. <S%G1199><s%>

And when it was told <S%G3377><s%> me how that the Jews <S%G2453><s%> laid <S%G2071><s%> wait <S%G1917><s%> for the man, <S%G435><s%> I sent <S%G3992><s%> straightway <S%G1824><s%> to you, and gave commandment <S%G3853><s%> to his accusers <S%G2725><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you what <S%G3588><s%> they had against <S%G4314><s%> him. Farewell. <S%G4517><s%>

Then <S%G3767><s%> the soldiers, <S%G4757><s%> as it was commanded <S%G1299><s%> them, took <S%G353><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and brought <S%G71><s%> him by night <S%G3571><s%> to Antipatris. <S%G494><s%>
On the morrow <S%G1887><s%> they left <S%G1439><s%> the horsemen <S%G2460><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> with him, and returned <S%G5290><s%> to the castle: <S%G3925><s%>

Who, <S%G3748><s%> when they came <S%G1525><s%> to Caesarea <S%G2542><s%>and delivered <S%G325><s%> the letter <S%G1992><s%> to the governor, <S%G2232><s%> presented <S%G3936><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> before him.

And when the governor <S%G2232><s%> had read <S%G314><s%> the letter, he asked <S%G1905><s%> of what <S%G4169><s%> province <S%G1885><s%> he was. And when he understood <S%G4441><s%> that he was of Cilicia; <S%G2791><s%>

I will hear <S%G1251><s%> you, said <S%G5346><s%> he, when <S%G3752><s%> your <S%G4675><s%> accusers <S%G2725><s%> are also <S%G2532><s%> come. <S%G3854><s%> And he commanded <S%G2753><s%> him to be kept <S%G5442><s%> in Herod's <S%G2264><s%> judgment <S%G4232><s%> hall. <S%G4232><s%>
